current_contact.agency: Arkansas Crime LabHot Spring Cnty Coroners Ofc

case_circumstances: This victim was hitch hiking and picked up in Louisville, Kentucky by another male subject enroute to Houston, Texas. They stopped for breakfast near Benton, Arkansas and after began driving again. The other male subject became tired and let the victim drive. The other male subject reports that he awoke and the cab of the vehicle being driven was filling up with water. The other subject got out but victim did not. This victim was under water for about 15 to 30 minutes. The victim was extracted from the vehicle and taken to the hospital where he expired 2 days later. This victim is possibly from New Haven, Connecticut traveling to California at the time.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is available and entered
case_clothing_with_body: 1 pair of corduroy trousers-size 28 inches and length 32 inches, 1 cut brown sweater, and 1 multi-colored long sleeved shirt-"John Henry"-neck size is 14 1/2 inches (32-33).
case_footwear: 1 pair of red/black/white sweat socks and 1 pair of brown boot-shoes-size M8.
case_jewelry: 26 cents found in right front pocket and 1 large plastic yellow comb.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
